snippet: The N.C.A.A. cited Caltech, a school with a sterling academic reputation, for a lack of institutional control of its Division III athletic program, specifically related to academics.
abstract: NCAA cites California Institute of Technology, a school with a sterling academic reputation, for a lack of institutional control of its Division III athletic program, specifically related to academics; disregards the fact that most of the infractions stem from Caltech’s unusual class registration system.
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. cited Caltech, a school with a sterling academic reputation, for a lack of institutional control of its Division III athletic program, specifically related to academics.

headline.seo: Caltech-N.C.A.A. Case Gives New Meaning to ‘Academically Ineligible’
headline.main: Caltech Gives New Meaning to ‘Academically Ineligible’
headline.print_headline: Caltech Gives New Meaning To ‘Academically Ineligible’
